title.text: Natural Language Directed Inference in the Presentation of Ontologies

abstractContent.text: It is hard to come up with a general formalisation of the problem of content determination in natural language generation because of the degree of domain-dependence that is involved.

entities.text: content determination in natural language generation

abstractContent.text: This paper presents a novel way of looking at a class of content determination problems in terms of a non-standard kind of inference, which we call natural language directed inference.
This is illustrated through examples from a system underdevelopment to present parts of ontologies in natural language.
Natural language directed inference represents an interesting challenge to research in automated reasoning and natural language processing.
